accused.name: Didier femme Nicolas le Vefue le Viel

confession.devil_appearance: Appeared as a man; she initially thought it was her husband
confession.seduction_context: Distressed over loss of pigs they had been fattening. Man approached her in barn - thought he was her husband, but she fell down and he promised her money for more pigs if she would renounce God and take him as master
powder_types: powder made from human rib bone
sabbat_activities: making hail (frustrated by ringing of bells)

testimony.quarrel_subject: what was due under marriage settlement

witnesses.name: Pierson Nicolle
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: lodger in her house for 21 months

accomplices_named.name: la Jobarde
accomplices_named.context: Went to sabbat twice in company with la Jobarde

accomplices_named.name: Jenotte Thoussainct
accomplices_named.context: Seen at sabbat - described as 'the first witch executed'

prior_accusations.context: Originally accused by la Jobarde; accused said she had done her great wrong

notable_quotes.speaker: Jennon femme Nicolas Colin (witness 1)
notable_quotes.french: gens de bien, et tient ladite Didier pour bonne chrestienne et fort devote
notable_quotes.english: good people, and considers said Didier a good Christian and very devout
notable_quotes.context: Daughter-in-law's testimony about living with accused for 14 years

notable_quotes.speaker: Didier le Vefue (accused)
notable_quotes.french: laquelle pour estre née le jour du Grand Vendredy pendant qu'on disoit la passion scavoit beaucoups de choses
notable_quotes.english: who, being born on Good Friday while the Passion was being said, knew many things
notable_quotes.context: Explaining how her mother knew healing remedies

notable_quotes.speaker: Didier le Vefue (accused)
notable_quotes.french: que non, et fut esté bien malheureuse, au contraire qu'elle ne desiroit que d'avoir des filles de luy
notable_quotes.english: no, and it would have been very unfortunate, on the contrary she only desired to have daughters from him
notable_quotes.context: Denying killing her late son's children

notable_quotes.speaker: Zabey femme Remy Grand Demenge (witness 9)
notable_quotes.french: de n'en rien dire a personne, car les gens sont sy mauvais maintenant
notable_quotes.english: to say nothing to anyone, because people are so bad nowadays
notable_quotes.context: Didier's warning when providing healing remedy

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Geoffroy (witness 8)
notable_quotes.french: mais pour tout cela il n'a point d'oppinion qu'elle soit autre que femme de bien et luy servy tres bon que de ses enseignements
notable_quotes.english: but for all that he has no opinion that she is other than a good woman and her teachings served him very well
notable_quotes.context: After describing elaborate healing ritual with cemetery soil

notable_quotes.speaker: Didier le Vefue (accused)
notable_quotes.french: qu'on la feroit dampner, pour ce qu'on luy faict dire choses qu'elle n'a pas faict . . . qu'elle n'avoit poinct faict mourir des gens ny gasté des biens, ains que ce faisoient les autres, et n'en estoit consentante d'aultant qu'elle voyoit bien qu'elle estoit abbusée
notable_quotes.english: that they would damn her, because they make her say things she hasn't done... that she hadn't killed people or damaged goods, but that others did this, and she wasn't consenting to it inasmuch as she saw well that she was abused/deceived

notable_quotes.speaker: Didier le Vefue (accused)
notable_quotes.french: qu'aucunesfois elle se propose comme elle se doict gouverner en sa vieillesse et ce qu'elle fera
notable_quotes.english: that sometimes she considers how she should conduct herself in her old age and what she will do

economic_context.details: Quarrels and lawsuits with Colas Gadel over dowry (he married widow of accused's brother Jean Thomas). Marriage settlement disputes with daughter-in-law Jennon. Goods worth 520 Fr after payment of costs; allowed to remain with heirs Nicolas and Claude after payment of 400 Fr.

harms_catalog.harm_description: Fever lasting 8 or 9 weeks, didn't recover despite remedies and herbs Didier applied to his arms
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Didier femme Nicolas le Vefue le Viel
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: dispute with her late son Colas, perhaps because he wasn't working
harms_catalog.method_alleged: touching on shoulder - Didier touched him and said he should leave, they would pay him. Did this and soon recovered, so suspected her of curing him by touching

harms_catalog.victim_name: Jennon fille de feu la Grande Marye
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Didier femme Nicolas le Vefue le Viel
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after eating apples given by Didier
harms_catalog.method_alleged: bewitched apples - became ill after eating them, but a day or two after Didier looked at it, leg was better

harms_catalog.harm_description: Ill for a month, expelling horrible matter from her body
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Didier femme Nicolas le Vefue le Viel
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after witness recovered from leg illness

harms_catalog.victim_name: cow belonging to Margueritte femme Demenge Bon Claude
harms_catalog.harm_description: Cow went very lame, herbs proved ineffective, had to be killed
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Didier femme Nicolas le Vefue le Viel
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Didier sent her small son Colas with herbs, but these proved ineffective

harms_catalog.attributed_to: Didier femme Nicolas le Vefue le Viel
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: quarrels and lawsuits with Didier's husband over dowry

harms_catalog.attributed_to: Didier femme Nicolas le Vefue le Viel
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: quarrels and lawsuits with Didier's husband over dowry

harms_catalog.harm_description: Loss of pigs they had been fattening - led to seduction by devil
harms_catalog.method_alleged: This was the distress that led to her seduction by Persin

harms_catalog.harm_description: Series of own animals which had done damage, or which she could not care for properly
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Didier femme Nicolas le Vefue le Viel (confessed)
Didier femme Nicolas le Vefue le Viel (confessed)

material_culture.context: Hung from 'rattelier des chevaux' (horse rack) on advice of reitres (soldiers) who had been billeted in house. Later used with ointment on it for treatment of swellings. Procureur fiscal of Blamont made enquiries about it; Nicolas said it had been taken away by soldiers
Seen handling a bone during sermon in previous Lent, which she then put away in her apron. Later confessed it was rib from a corpse; Persin told her to make powder with this to kill animals
Given to her by Persin; also made from human rib bone
Persin gave her money for more pigs which turned out to be pieces of glass
Given to Jennon to give to sergent at Blamont to thank him for treating her mother well; sergent refused them, Jennon and her niece ate them and became ill
Multiple references: herbs applied to Pierson Nicolle's arms for fever; herbs sent to Nicolas Geoffroy for fever treatment; herbs from graves used in healing rituals; herbs sent for cow treatment
Instructed to measure length and thickness of leg with blessed candle, then put candle with offering of 2 deniers and holy water in clean sheet, hang from eaves on side of house towards St Anthoine
Used in healing rituals - to be included with blessed candle and offering; also to put herbs in for fever remedy
Take soil from grave of last person who died, hang it round neck with herbs, say prayers, replace soil at end. For treatment when 'surprins de l'air d'un trespassé'
Offering to be included with blessed candle and holy water
To wrap blessed candle, offering, and holy water to hang from eaves
Used on dog's skull for treatment of swellings

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial; residence of accused and several witnesses
Location of witness 1, Jennon femme Nicolas Colin
Origin of witness 3, Pierson Nicolle, tixerand
Location of witness 8, Nicolas Geoffroy, maire
Referenced multiple times: procureur fiscal location, sergent location, destination when traveling with witnesses
Pierson Nicolle dove into fountain to recover his knife, became ill after
Location where accused was allegedly seduced by devil/Persin
Multiple references: where Thouvenin Bergier saw accused handling bone during sermon; healing instructions began 'as soon as one left church'
Source of grave soil and herbs for healing remedies; location for neuvaine prayers
Attended sabbat twice with la Jobarde; location not specified

historical_context.military_details: Reitres (soldiers) had been billeted in Nicolas le Vefue's house; they gave advice about using dog's head and later took it away
economic_hardship_indicators: Loss of pigs being fattened led to accused's distress and seduction
Concern about caring for animals properly
religious_calendar_references: Good Friday (mother born on this day during Passion)

prior_legal_disputes.description: Quarrels and lawsuits with Colas Gadel (who married widow of accused's brother) over dowry
Quarrels with daughter-in-law Jennon and husband over what was due under marriage settlement, on several occasions
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: no harm resulted; they intended to separate households but did not do so

legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Confessed to François Charier, sergent, while in prison

hearsay_chains.content: Heard that Jennon had accused Didier of causing death of her children, but Jennon later told her she hadn't spoken of it and never had the thought
For last 3 years heard 'par bruit commun et comme en cachette qu'on la soupçonnoit pour sorciere'
Had not heard any harm except during last year when there were rumours of witchcraft

emotional_state_notes: During torture said 'qu'on la feroit dampner' (they would damn her)
Claimed she was being made to say things she hadn't done

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Said Margueritte veuve Demenge Vaultrin (la Jobarde) had done her great wrong by accusing her
Made no objections - accepted testimonies but denied accusations of doing harm

third_parties.context: Late person from whom Claudon Thomas learned herbal remedy for horses

third_parties.context: Mother who died when accused was very young; born on Good Friday during Passion, knew many things including healing remedies

third_parties.name: Persin
third_parties.context: Devil who seduced accused, had intercourse with her, gave her money (glass pieces) and black powder, demanded malefices

extraction_metadata.notes: This is an exceptionally detailed trial record with 16 witnesses, extensive testimony about healing practices, and a complex confession narrative. The case is notable for the accused's reputation as a healer, her mother's special birth on Good Friday giving her knowledge, the tension between testimonies supporting her good character and suspicions of witchcraft, and her partial retraction under torture. Multiple witnesses testified she was a good Christian despite long-standing rumors. The healing practices involved elaborate rituals combining folk medicine, Christian prayer, and material objects (cemetery soil, blessed candles, holy water, herbs from graves). Economic context includes property disputes and animal losses. The confession mentions sabbat attendance with la Jobarde and seeing Jenotte Thoussainct (already executed). Property worth 520 Fr allowed to heirs after 400 Fr payment.
